name: The Aquatic Ruins
pages:
Research Notes #54

Today I was relaxing, gazing into the water, when I noticed a bizarre shape beneath the surface. It wasn't the usual ruin of the Folonians; this one had... something different about it.

As much as I don't

particularly enjoy getting my coat wet, driven by curiosity, I swam towards the structure until something pulled me down into the depths.
The moment of panic at not being able to resurface quickly gave way to curiosity as I noticed that the air bubbles, also being pulled from the

surface, were at the same time a perfect source of oxygen.

What I saw down there left me speechless. It was a temple like none I'd ever seen before! It seems to have been a place dedicated to the worship of something very specific that I had never found

information about anywhere else.
Inside were shards, benches, and a macabre basin filled with sand of the souls that created a reverse current to the one that had brought me down here, but still generated air bubbles, as if the material itself was screaming incessantly,

with no one to hear it.

Reading the inscriptions on the prismarine outside, I noticed that they were written in the same ancient alphabet found in the crumbling tower and in the enchantment tables.
However, there was an ambiguous character that didn't correspond

to any of the known ones. It seemed to be a character used for both "heart" and "eye", perhaps indicating the "thing" that was in the cage atop the altar, to which they prayed.

Another thing that struck me is that this temple had no Guardian, apart from

a few Folonians armed with tridents or shells. Whatever was celebrated there must have been taken away even before their downfall as a population.


Were they abandoned too?
